events.message: The claimant reported a vehicle collision that occurred on the morning of March 31st, resulting in damage to their car and minor injury.
The claim was reviewed and classified under Auto Accident category, confirming all details matched the auto insurance coverage.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the claimantâ€™s case and to assist with the claim process and documentation.
The insurance company sent an acknowledgment confirming receipt of the claim and informing the claimant about the next steps.
The claimant was requested to submit photographs of the damaged vehicle, police report, and medical bills related to the accident.
All requested documents including accident photos, police report, and medical receipts were submitted by the claimant promptly.
An internal investigation was initiated to verify claim details, assess the extent of vehicle damage, and evaluate liability.
The investigation concluded with confirmation that the claimant was not at fault and all damages are covered under the policy.
A settlement offer was proposed based on the investigation findings covering repairs and medical expenses from the accident.
The claimant provided positive feedback on the clarity and fairness of the proposed settlement amount for their claim.
Following customer acceptance, the claim was formally approved confirming the payout of the agreed settlement amount.
The insurance company issued the payment to the claimant's bank account covering vehicle repairs and medical costs.
The claim was officially closed after full payment was confirmed and no further customer queries were pending.
All claim documents and related information were archived securely for future reference in accordance with company policy.
